title: Dinner Plate
text: When porcelain from China and Japan was at the height of fashion, European aristocrats would commission pieces hand-painted with their own coat of arms.  This plate is one of a dinner service commissioned by the Spanish Duque de Agrada.  The Institute also owns a portrait of the duke (currently hanging in this gallery).
description: Chinese Export Partial Dinner Service, about 1780, porcelain with arms of owner, Duque de Agrada, on all pieces. Made for the Portuguese Market
